alert.note: Alert for Bath; Montgomery (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 9:16PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Montgomery and southwestern Bath Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 916 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Judy, or 7 miles northwest of Mount Sterling, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sharpsburg around 920 PM EDT. Grassy Lick around 925 PM EDT. Judy around 930 PM EDT. Mount Sterling, Stoops, Flat Creek and Wades Mill around 935 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Ewington, Prewitt, Klondike, Camargo, Howards Mill, Gatewoods Station, Coons Station, Stepstone, Upper Spencer, Peeled Oak and Levee. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 105 and 117. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
